alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 1:17PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Eagle County through 145 PM MDT... At 117 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Gypsum, or 15 miles northeast of Glenwood Springs, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Eagle County, including the following locations... Dotsero. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 131 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
